column2: Unique for each sample in study, should be informative/descriptive  of sample - A sample at time point 1 (09/09/2014) depth 3m could be NA.t1.D3.09092014
column3: Can be the same as sample name, or name of sample tube.  For human-associated samples it is de-identifying
column4: A description of the sample that can include site, subject, sample matter
column5: Refers to the number assigned to the specific metagenome being sampled:
column6: Name of the TAXON_ID e.g. 408172 is marine metagenome
column8: Height above ground or sea in the air (in meters)
column9: Is the latitude, longitude and elevation assigned from a geographic reference? y or n
column10: The day and time of sampling, single point in time using a 24 hour time format
column11: The time of sampling, single point in time using a 24 hour time format
column12: Depth undergraound for soil or under water for aquatic samples.  Should be in meters
column13: The geographical origin of the sample as defined by the country
column14: Height of land above sea level in meters
column15: Classification of the location where the sample was obtained
column16: Classification of a specific feature in the biome
column17: Classification of the material being sampled
column18: Classification of the site by latitude and longitude in decimal degrees
column19: Classification of the site by latitude and longitude in decimal degrees
column20: temperature of the sample at time of sampling in degrees C
column24: You can choose to add a field for everything you think may be required for analysis

column5: required for all sample submissions e.g. marine metagenome is 408172
column8: required for all sample submissions - 0 should be used if sample is not in the air above ground
column9: required for all sample submissions. There is a georeferencing tool available on the EMP web site:
column10: required for all sample submissions Date should be in MM/DD/YY format.  Time can be truncated or ommitted or entered in a separate column collection_time
column11: not required but recommended when available
column12: required for all sample submissions, should be in meters
column13: required for all sample submissions, chosen from the GAZ ontology
column14: required for all sample submissions, distinguish from altitude which is height above land or sea in the air.
column15: required for all sample submissions. The world's major communities, classified according to the predominant vegetation and characterized by adaptations of organisms to that particular environment
column16: required for all sample submissions e.g. Was the feature a forest, grassland, agricultural site
column17: required for all sample submissions e.g. soil, sea water, feces
column18: required for all sample submissions. Please convert from GPS co-ordinates  or DD MM SS to decimal degrees
column19: required for all sample submissions. Please convert from GPS co-ordinates  or DD MM SS to decimal degrees
column20: required for all water sample submissions.
column24: optional for sample submission but highly desired if you have additional information
